results.title: Over Two Million Infant Swings and Rockers Recalled After Baby’s Death
results.abstract: Hanging straps on certain MamaRoo swing and RockaRoo rocker models posed a risk of strangulation to crawling infants. The company is offering free strap fasteners to consumers.

media.caption: Several models of infant swings and rockers made by the company 4moms were recalled because they posed a strangulation hazard, the U.S. Consumer Product Safety Commission said.
media.copyright: Oliver Berg/picture alliance via Getty Images

results.title: Should I get a fourth shot now, or wait for an Omicron-specific booster?

results.title: F.D.A. Clears Path for Hearing Aids to Be Sold Over the Counter
results.abstract: The agency’s action opens the door to cheaper, more accessible devices without a prescription or medical exam.

media.caption: Hearing aids will soon be sold over the counter under the Food and Drug Administration’s new rule.

results.title: F.B.I. Interviewed Top White House Lawyers About Missing Trump Documents
results.abstract: Pat A. Cipollone and Patrick F. Philbin are the most senior former Trump aides known to have been interviewed in the investigation into his handling of classified material.

media.caption: Patrick F. Philbin, the former deputy White House counsel, is among eight people who work or used to work for President Donald J. Trump who have been contacted by the F.B.I. since a grand jury was formed this year.

results.title: Why the ‘Big One’ Could Be Something Other Than an Earthquake
results.abstract: A new report finds that climate change has increased the risk of a monthlong superstorm.

results.title: Alligator Kills 88-Year-Old Woman in South Carolina
results.abstract: The deadly attack, in a gated community near Hilton Head Island, S.C., was at least the fourth in the country this year.

media.caption: Alligator attacks, like one after which a woman was found dead near Hilton Head Island, S.C., are “rare but not surprising,” said Maj. Angela Viens of the Beaufort County sheriff’s office.

results.title: Justice Dept. Objects to Releasing Affidavit Used to Search Trump’s Home
results.abstract: Prosecutors say its release would compromise the investigation into Donald J. Trump’s handling of secret documents after he left office. Now a judge must decide.

media.copyright: Sarah Silbiger for The New York Times

results.title: Pain Doctor Who Sexually Assaulted Patients Found Dead at Rikers
results.abstract: Ricardo Cruciani’s death, just weeks after his conviction, was a suspected suicide. He was the 12th person to die this year in custody or shortly after release.

results.title: An Oscars Apology for Sacheen Littlefeather, 50 Years After Brando Protest
results.abstract: The Apache activist and actress was booed onstage in 1973 after she refused the best actor award on Marlon Brando’s behalf and criticized Hollywood for its depictions of Native Americans.
org_facet: Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences

media.caption: Sacheen Littlefeather was booed and cheered after she explained that she was representing Marlon Brando and that he could not accept the award because of “the treatment of American Indians today by the film industry.”

results.title: Clean Toilets, Inspired Teachers: How India’s Capital Is Fixing Its Schools
results.abstract: The Aam Aadmi Party, which rose to power in New Delhi, is overhauling an education system that serves as a lifeline for millions of families looking to break the cycle of poverty.

media.caption: A classroom at Sarvodaya Vidyalaya in New Delhi. The transformation of Delhi’s education system has made public schools more successful and desirable.
media.copyright: Saumya Khandelwal for The New York Times
